intro: Laetia casearioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick stems and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with dark green, velvety leaves. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Laetia casearioides is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
